page.title: 03The Shoot, Horningsham
page.content: Horningsham is a well-known centre for {pheasant shooting}and about 4000 are shot each year by a syndicate of 15; 9 going out at a time. The shoots are held on twenty days a year, usually Thursday and Saturday. Between fifteen and twenty beaters accompany each shoot. About 6,250 young pheasants, or poults, are reared and released, aged 7 weeks, each year. They are a minimum of 22 weeks old when they are shot. During the course of each year 14 tons of compounded food and 60 tons of wheat are used to feed the pheasants. The total area of the shoot is approximately 2,500 acres.
